channel.title: Applet Parameters
channel.description:
the rs applet asks for these parameters, but they are not provided with the other parameters, where and what are they?
[code][05:01:25][AppletLoaderContext] key=openwinjs value=null [05:01:29][AppletLoaderContext] key=MAYSCRIPT value=null[/code]
and then keeps repeating
[code][05:01:29][AppletLoaderContext] key=MAYSCRIPT value=null[/code]
about every 5 seconds, WHAT IS IT ASKING FOR?

item.title: Applet Parameters
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

if anyone was wondering, i just created my own netscape package which solves this “null” problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Applet Parameters
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:15, topic:256299”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=338553.msg2628669#msg2628669 date=1231978682]
Just write your only applet which spits out the value and run it both with and without MAYSCRIPT in the browser. Not that hard but cbf.
[/quote]wat[/quote]

He said test what actually happens by writing your own applet and testing it both ways. In a far less clear way however.

Read full topic

item.title: Applet Parameters
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:11, topic:256299”][quote author=qauters link=topic=338553.msg2627347#msg2627347 date=1231883215]

I wanted to know about the client applet, which doesnt have that tag.

The client certainly does, when it defines the applet using the object tags.
See the source of this:
http://world51.runescape.com/plugin.js?param=o1,a0,m1,s0

document.write('<param name=mayscript value=true>');

[/quote]
that’s when javascript is enabled.[/quote]
Of course, otherwise there is no use of mayscript. Mayscript allows you to access the JSObject.

Read full topic

I wanted to know about the client applet, which doesnt have that tag.
[/quote]
The client certainly does, when it defines the applet using the object tags.
See the source of this:
http://world51.runescape.com/plugin.js?param=o1,a0,m1,s0

document.write('<param name=mayscript value=true>');

that’s when javascript is enabled.

No JDK 1.3 support for APPLET!!

So, it is what java says. (unless you thought I meant mayscript = true literary in the object clause.)[/quote]

I wanted to know about the client applet, which doesnt have that tag.

item.title: Applet Parameters
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

maycript is provided! It’s within the applet tags, unless it has to load it using object tags. A parameter mayscript = true is added in that case.

According to the code, openwinjs is used to determine if the javascript is openjs. Which means it has to use a different way of retrieving getCodeBase().

Read full topic

item.title: Applet Parameters
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

MAYSCRIPT indicates that the applet is allowed to access the scripting objects (e.g. JavaScript) of the web page. The applet must be specifically designed to utilize the page script objects or MAYSCRIPT is of no use.

http://www.htmlcodetutorial.com/applets/_APPLET_MAYSCRIPT.html

Read full topic
